evidence.text: MOTION to Compel to Enforce the Court's February 10, 2022 Order and for In Camera Review by Taiwan Scott, South Carolina State Conference of the NAACP, The. Response to Motion due by 4/6/2022. (Attachments: # 1 Exhibit Ex. A - August 12 Dean Email, ... # 9 Exhibit Ex. I - Privilege Log)No proposed order.(Bryant, Christopher) (Entered: 03/23/2022)

RESPONSE in Opposition re 198 MOTION to Compel to Enforce the Court's February 10, 2022 Order and for In Camera Review Response filed by Wallace H Jordan, James H Lucas, Chris Murphy.Reply to Response to Motion due by 4/4/2022 Add an additional 3 days only if served by mail or otherwise allowed under Fed. R. Civ. P. 6. (Attachments: # 1 Exhibit February 14, 2022 Production Letter, ...)(Parente, Michael) (Entered: 03/28/2022)

extracted.value: MOTION to Compel to Enforce Court's February 10, 2022 Order filed by SC NAACP (ECF No. 198), with House Defendants' opposition (ECF No. 202)

evidence.source_document: Status Update Regarding Settlement by Legislation
evidence.text: presented to the Governor on or before May 12, 2022, and signed into law on or before May 17, 2022

extracted.value: 12 days: Settlement maps enacted by May 17, 2022

evidence.source_document: Status Update Regarding Settlement by Legislation
evidence.text: House Defendants shall amend an already existing bill, H.1024, as soon as practicable so as to include the Settlement Maps in H.1024. It is anticipated that H.1024 will pass the Senate and be delivered to the Governor for signature on or before May 12, 2022. Thereafter, the Governor will have until May 17, 2022 to sign and enact H.1024 into law.

extracted.value: House Defendants shall amend H.1024 to include Settlement Maps, with passage by May 12, 2022 and Governor signing by May 17, 2022

evidence.source_document: Status Update Regarding Settlement by Legislation
evidence.text: SC NAACP will voluntarily dismiss Counts One and Two without prejudice by filing a stipulation under Fed. R. Civ. P. 15(a)(2) to amend their Complaint to remove Counts One and Two.

extracted.value: SC NAACP will dismiss Counts One and Two without prejudice

evidence.source_document: Status Update Regarding Settlement by Legislation
evidence.text: If H.1024 is not enacted as agreed upon, House Defendants will provide written consent that there is good cause for SC NAACP to amend their Complaint to re-allege Counts One and Two, or may refile Counts One and Two in a new action.

extracted.value: If H.1024 is not enacted, House Defendants will consent to refile Counts One and Two

evidence.source_document: Status Update Regarding Settlement by Legislation
evidence.text: the Court denied the Parties’ request for a consent decree because the Parties could not satisfy the prerequisites established in Lawyer v. Dep’t of Justice, 521 U.S. 567 (1997).
